pages.title: Mana
pages.text: At the bottom left of your screen is your mana bar. Mana is a regenerating resource required to cast spells, and is primarily influenced by the Spell Effects within a given spell. However, some Spell Shapes have a additive multiplier that gets applied to the mana cost of any spell they're in.$(br2)Mana regenerates at a rate of 1 per second, and can increase to a rate of 6 per second by wearing Wizard Robes.

pages.title: Burnout
pages.text: When you don't have enough mana for a spell, and cast it anyways, you'll get a nasty effect known as Burnout. Burnout has a few drawbacks to be weary of:$(br) - Your attacks are sluggish$(br) - Your health won't regenerate$(br) - Your hunger drains faster$(br) - Your maximum mana is reduced$(br2)The good news is Burnout goes away on its own, albeit slowly.

pages.title: Mana Lock
pages.text: Mana Lock is much like Burnout in the way that it reduces your maximum mana. However, unlike Burnout, it doesn't drain over time nor does it have the other side effects.$(br2)When the effect expires, it will simply go away all at once, allowing your mana to regenerate to full once again!
